concept-wr.title: Devices Tab
concept-wr.shortdesc: The Devices tab on the Inventory Detail page presents details for non-NIC PCI devices that can be made available for use by VMs.

conbody.p: US64378 new topic. TBD: Are supported devices listed in the Release Notes or the New Hardware table?All non-NIC PCI devices that can be exposed to a guest are listed. They are automatically detected by the system, and cannot be manually added or deleted.

note.p: PCI passthrough and SR-IOV Ethernet interfaces are listed separately. For more information, see .

conbody.draft-comment: This is present as a parameter list which isn't in keeping with any of the other tab topics. Leaving for now but, if this is similar to the lists in the other tab topics, you should standardize on a similar format.

pd.p: The name of the device, as identified by the system inventory.
The PCI address of the device.
The ID of the device, assigned by the vendor.
The name of the device, as identified by the host's Linux kernel.
The NUMA node of the device.
Whether exposure to VMs is enabled for the device.

conbody.p: To view usage information for individual devices, see . I don't know if this is a good practice. Something to consider...
For a list of devices supported by Titanium Server, refer to the Release Notes.
